data.title: node-gyp / EACCES / pty.js - cannot install package
data.body:
Hello everyone,

I spent the whole week trying to fix that, but I cannot get it working.

apm -v:

```
apm  0.108.0
npm  1.4.4
node 0.10.32
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1
```

Here is the error I get:

```
> pty.js@0.2.4 install /tmp/apm-install-dir-114929-18598-11wdboh/node_modules/term2/node_modules/pty.js
> node-gyp rebuild

gyp ERR! System Linux 3.13.0-24-generic

data.title: Soft wrap causes editor to hang when less than 1 character wide
data.body:
Steps to reproduce: 
   1) Make sure the tree view is visible by opening a folder.
   2) Open a file with some text in it
   3) Ensure soft wrap is enabled
   4) Resize the window so the editor is either barely or not at all visible.
   5) Editor should now hang, while the rest of Atom is responsive.

![atom-soft-wrap-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1095139/4831017/9aad48de-5f91-11e4-8404-60a26dff2923.png)

OS: Windows 8.1
Version: 0.140.0

data.title: Error: Invariant Violation: replaceState(...): Can only update a mounted or mounting component.
data.body:
# Bug Report

![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/927609/4830995/7ed9b4b2-5f91-11e4-856c-f2e7f6987407.png)
- **Atom Version:** 0.140.0
- **OS Version:**   linux 3.17.1-1-ARCH
- **Misc Versions**
  - apm  0.108.0
  - npm  1.4.4
  - node 0.10.32
  - python 2.7.8
  - git 2.1.2

1. Wait a couple of minutes, probably happens each time the config is read from fs

data.title: Remove feedback package
data.body:
I've had the feedback package disabled for months, for me it takes up valuable real estate on the status bar and draws attention to itself.

I think we are at the point where we can remove it and instead just add helpful items to the Help menu.

This PR removes the package and adds several new help menu items for faq, issues, roadmap, and discussions.

@lee-dohm any ideas for other helpful things to put in the help menu?

data.title: Atom is conflating two spaces with a tab
data.body:
## Steps to reproduce
1. Open a new buffer.
2. Press tab key. (A single character, the width of two spaces, appears.)
3. Save that file.
4. Run `hexdump -C` on it.
## Expected behavior

An ASCII tab character followed by a line feed, like:

```
> hexdump -C test
00000000  09 0a                                             |..|
00000002
```
## Actual behavior

```
> hexdump -C test
00000000  20 20 0a                                          |  .|
00000003
```

This shows that the file consists of three bytes: two ASCII spaces followed by a line feed.

Moreover, opening the corrected file (with an ASCII tab) in Atom is not observably different to the file with two ASCII spaces. Both are represented the same in the UI.

I am using "Version 0.136.0 (0.136.0)".

data.title: How to fold level 1 code but not comments
browser is not focused when opening a web page
data.body: When I click on a link or do an activity which requires a browser to open, the default browser opens up but the Atom editor is still the focused window. I see this behavior on Windows 8.1

data.title: Unable to start atom in normal and safe mode
data.body:
On version `0.141.0-edec6b9`, every time I start an atom instance in normal mode or in safe mode I get the following error: 

```
Error: Cannot find module '../src/module-cache'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:344:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:286:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:373:17)
    at require (module.js:392:17)
    at window.onload (file:///Users/cedric/github/atom/static/index.js:13:19) index.js:48window.onload index.js:48
```

Rebuilding the module cache using the corresponding command doesn't help, cleaning the storage directory didn't help neither.

However starting Atom in dev mode works fine.

data.title: Enter won't work after a while
data.body:
When I open atom after a while, I can't make new lines in my code. Tried restart atom it still the same. Switched to sublime it works. Tried restart my computer the problem is still there. Other keys are working properly.

Atom version: 0.140.0
MacOs version: 10.9.5

data.title: Lag with Plain Text
data.body:
I'm working on a Arch Linux x64 with atom v.0.139.0. 
I realized that editing a file in Plain Text  mode, the editor was awfully slow. When I'm typing everything takes time to appear on the screen and every ~10 seconds it lags even more for 1 second. Also, the wheel zoom is really slow. But, when I switch my file to C or C++ everything come back really fluid.
Someone has an idea why Plain Text is so slow?

data.title: Add initial instructions to build rpm from sources, ...
data.body: ... add packaging dependency for Fedora

data.title: Help users understand why cmd-t may do nothing
data.body:
It's pretty confusing to open Atom and follow the Getting Started guide but have nothing happen when you press cmd-t. Add some text to the Getting Started doc to help out these poor souls.

See https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/issues/38

data.title: Add support for changing editor encoding
data.body:
- Upgrades pathwatcher and text-buffer for new encoding APIs
- Adds a new [encoding-selector](https://github.com/atom/encoding-selector) package that mirrors the grammar selector behavior
- Put the current encoding on the status bar
- Allow changing of the encoding
- Add auto detect option that uses [jschardet](https://github.com/aadsm/jschardet)

![encodings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/4818732/4680b1c8-5ef7-11e4-9ce2-8f68e58fb9a7.gif)

Closes #1806

data.title: Move line up/down isn't working on linux
data.body:
I'm back to Atom since it got a bit better, but the ctrl+up/down key shortcut isn't working on linux.
I just installed v0.140.0, I'm not sure if it ever worked before.
I checked the console, tried safe mode, still not working.

data.body:
Hello All, 

I recently updated the operating system to OSX Yosemite (10.10) and I'm now not able to open atom from the command line. Every time I try to open Atom, I get an error.

```
LSOpenURLsWithRole() failed for the application /Applications/Atom.app with error -10810.
```

Please help.
/Ven

data.title: Expand command registry to handle native events
data.body:
As we explored the overall API for creating views in packages (#3752), we realized that it's awkward to have two different mechanisms for subscribing to command events and native events in packages. It would be nice to use the same pattern to subscribe to things like `core:cancel` and `click`. Currently click handlers need to be registered with `addEventListener`.

We've decided to expand the role of the command registry, renaming it to the event registry and using it to register event handlers for both native and custom events. This will ensure a consistent event subscription experience for package authors:
## Tasks
- [x] Expand jQuery on/trigger retrofit to cover all event types
  - [ ] Ensure vim mode specs still pass
- [ ] Honor `::bubbles` property for native events
- [ ] Allow event capture in addition to bubbling
- [ ] Retrofit addEventListener to add events to event registry
- [ ] Rename to `EventRegistry`
- [ ] Assign to `atom.events` and deprecate `atom.commands`

data.title: Changing an underlying image file does not update the view
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- open up an image (say a JPG) to preview it in a tab, then i can view the image directly in the editor.
- change the image on the file system
- close the tab and reopen the image in the editor

Whats wrong:

The preview still shows the old image, no matter what I do.
Only restarting atom would show the new preview!

https://atom.io/faq

data.title: Documentation in multiple formats
data.body: It would be nice to have documentation in other formats like pdf, epub or Linux man page. As far I can see TomDoc can't handle it, which complicates whole thing. Probably it will be necessary to use external tools. Any thoughts?

data.title: WIP: Changes for a new package view system
data.body:
### TODO
- [x] Move the ViewRegistry to `atom.views`
- [x] Add HTMLRequire
- [x] Add the polymer stuff to core
- [x] Publish `elmer` https://github.com/atom/elmer
- [x] Put the template system through the ringer. Does it do all we need / want? https://github.com/benogle/template-explore
- [ ] Move templating stuff out of atom and into its own file
- [ ] Add a couple global template filters (pluralize, classList)
- [x] Document `ViewRegistry` 
- [ ] Document `HTMLRequire` 

Closes #3977 
Closes #3752

data.title: .desktop file not working on linux
data.body:
I've built atom on linux (debian sid) from sources. I didn't create the .deb package.
Atom starts correctly if I launch it from the command line. If I launch it from Gnome Shell menu or opening a file in Nautilus, I see the icon on the top left and the wheel spinning for about ten second until the window closes.

This is my `~/.local/share/applications/atom.desktop` file:

```
[Desktop Entry]
Name=Atom
Comment=A hackable text editor for the 21st Century.
GenericName=Text Editor
Exec=/usr/local/bin/atom
Icon=atom
Type=Application
StartupNotify=true
Categories=GNOME;GTK;Utility;TextEditor;
MimeType=text/plain;
```

data.title: Make view registry global
data.body: Until now, we've located the view registry on `atom.workspace`. This makes testing things like the panel and pane containers a bit awkward because we don't want to make them dependent on the workspace, but they need a view registry in order to function. The association of views to models is enough of a first class concept to stand on its own as its own global service available at `atom.views`.

## Steps to reproduce
- Open a markdown file
- Preview it
- Focus the preview
- Split the preview to the left
- Edit the markdown file.
- Error shows up

data.title: Search (with CTRL/CMD + P) undesired behaviour
data.body:
When searching, I think the behaviour should be improved by showing, as a first result, the exact match.

Take this situation fro example:
![example](http://i.imgur.com/G6OXRap.png)

Because I started to type the format of the file, it would be correct to assume that the file I'm searching for is "log.html" and it should be in the first position, immediately followed by "login.html"

data.title: Throw on non-release builds if translating positions on destroyed editor
data.body:
References #3789

Its possible that bundled packages stray into this corner case, so Id like us to catch and fix misbehaving packages before exposing users to any exceptions. Once we go one release with this turned on, we can enable the exception for all builds.

module.exports.WindowEventHandler.onKeydown /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/window-event-handler.js:151
```

The problem seems to be in [`Pane::setContainer`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/pane.coffee#L65). The event is fired before the container is actually set. Modifying it to set the container before firing the event allows the view to be accessed.

data.title: Bug in TextBuffer::setTextInBufferRange() ?
data.body:
Hi, 

I'm not sure, but something seems not logical to me. According to the doc of _TextBuffer::setTextInBufferRange()_ :

>   Public: Set the text in the given range.
> - `range` A {Range}
> - `text` A {String}
> - `normalizeLineEndings` (optional) {Boolean} (default: true)
>   
>   Returns the {Range} of the inserted text.

But when passing a Range argument to the method, I do not observe a text replacement, but an insert.

I've seen in the unit tests that you use an array as param, witch works as excepted : the old text is _replaced_ by the given one.
## Steps to reproduce :

```
 atom --safe
```
- add some text in a new file : `1234` in the first line
- then in developper tools console :

``` javascript
textBuffer = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor().getBuffer();
textBuffer.setTextInRange([[0,0], [0,1]], 'a');
```

=> **Ok** first line becomes `a234`
- now trying to replace back the 'a' by '1', using a Range argument :

``` javascript
textBuffer.setTextInRange(new Range([0,0], [0,1]), '1')
```

=> **Not Ok** first line becomes `1a234`, it's not a replace but an insert

data.title: Enter key not working on OSX Yosemite
data.body:
I just install OSX Yosemite on my mac book pro and I cannot push Enter key anymore on my code. I think it will be something about the actualization, but I am not really sure about it.
At first time I thought that it was a permissions issue, but I set the permissions and nothing happen.

Could you reproduce it?

Loving my Atom,
Thank you in advantage :)
